post_title: Glum view of the largest city in Colombia
post_content:
View this post on Instagram

Queda una semana para el 11, que creen que es lo mejor? . . . #cuarentena #yomequedoencasa #bogotaüá®üá¥ #fotodeldia #dronedesire #colombia #dronephotography #bogotart #bogotaÃÅ #bogota #domingo

A post shared by David Rico (@_primedest) on May 3, 2020 at 8:57am PDT

Pablo Escobar had probably believed that nothing changes in his nation without his permission, however, these are different times. @_primedest‚Äôs picture of Bogot√° clearly shows us the virus‚Äô chilling impact on the city, which has a population of approximately 8 million.
sub_category: 15 Images That Capture the Haunting Beauty of Empty Cities
sub_category_description:
Plunged into disarray by the pandemic, these stunning cities bear little resemblance to their former selves; a foreign, mystifying, yet beautiful sight. 
 
As COVID-19 gathers pace and wreaks further havoc throughout the globe, countries are forced to extend stay-at-home orders to preserve the lives of their citizens. Cities and streets are, therefore, desolate and devoid of people, revealing an all-new side to their landscape that is moving and eerie at the same time. From the lit-up streets of Australia to picturesque sunsets at Miami, these overwhelming images of famous cities also serve as subtle reminders to just why we fell in love with them in the first place.

post_content:
View this post on Instagram

Wuhan, China // Wuhan: The long night #quarantinecities #quarantine #covid19 #coronavirus #corona #lockdown #emptycities #pandemic #pandemic2020 #emergency #workfromhome #stayhome #selfisolation #socialdistancing #wuhan #china #coronaviruschina

A post shared by Quarantine cities (@quarantinecities) on Mar 29, 2020 at 8:15am PDT

Birthplace of the pandemic, the bustling Wuhan city has paid a heavy price with hardly any of its 10 million-plus population seen in the open. While some might call it poetic justice, @quarantinecities‚Äô image certainly strikes deep and demonstrates the mammoth problem at hand.

post_title: Aerial view of the Miami of Middle East
post_content:
View this post on Instagram

Tel Aviv | Ghost town April 15, 2020 ~ 8:11am

A post shared by Tal Revivo (@talrevivo) on Apr 17, 2020 at 10:51am PDT

This @talrevivo image demonstrates the breadth of destruction caused by the pandemic. Renowned for its night-life and delightful Italian meals, Tel Aviv in Israel seems to have come to standstill, with citizens prioritizing health over hobnobbing.

post_title: Eerie evening in the City of Lights
post_content:
View this post on Instagram

Empty. Breathtaking, but at the same time eerie in a way... ‚Ä¢ üì∏ #seemyparis by @avecmar

A post shared by wandering the streets of paris (@seemyparis) on Apr 19, 2020 at 1:27am PDT

Once crowded in by countless lovers, the Eiffel Tower, portrayed beautifully by @seemyparis sits alone and abandoned, making for a sorry sight. Paris, which pulls in an approximate record 30-million tourists annually, stands quiet but resilient ahead of an uncertain tomorrow.

post_content:
View this post on Instagram

Quietest I‚Äôve seen Hindley St in my lifetime. Let alone a Saturday night. Last time I could freely walk down the middle of it on a Saturday night was after the Crows 98 premiership, and it was a tad busier then. Looking forward to Better Days again.

A post shared by Ashley (@starkeyz) on Apr 26, 2020 at 3:29am PDT

Back when everything used to be the way it should be, Hindley Street was rocking with classic cafes, bookstores and workspaces. @starkeyz herein reveals something entirely different, with not even a single soul visible on this famed street in the 20-minute city.

Alone ‚Ä¢ Los Angeles, California ‚Ä¢ Stay quarantined my friends! ü§ô . . . @kriskuganathan starring in the new walking dead poster . . . . #sonyalpha #ready2_shoot #citiesinquarantine #sonyalphapro #coronavirus #covid_19 #losangeles #night_owlz #citygrammers #losangeles_la #conquer_la #rsa_night #agameoftones #conquer_ca #shotzdelight #heatercentral #citykillerz #streetphotography #street_vision #artofvisuals #picoftheday #ig_captures #moodygrams #bayshooters #vibesofvisuals #tonekillers #illgrammers #fatalframes #pmphotoassignments #weownthenight

The entertainment capital of the world often starts its day after sunset, as people head out for a night of heavy partying. @daneamacher, however, shows a lesser-known side of the city, which has an economy bigger than that of Saudi Arabia and Switzerland.

Locals will tell you that this 17 km-long engineering marvel in Lisbon, Portugal is filled with speeding cars that seem ready to outpace the wind. Fast forward to April and the only thing dotting the scenery are clouds, the bridge being left well alone.

post_content:
View this post on Instagram

A normally-busy underground passageway at London's Kings Cross station stands empty. The two tube lines which it connects are devoid of passengers. Another sign of the Corona times. Read more about my travels around the globe at www.wanderingsarah.com. #nobodyoutthere #emptycities #deserted #silent #underground #mydarlinglondon #ilovelondon #thisislondon #prettycitylondon #londonbylondoners #londonüá¨üáß #kingscross #tube #metro #londonunderground #traveltheworld #travelmore #traveladdict #seetheworld #girlswhotravel #solotravel #worldtravel #worldcapture #lockdown #storyofthestreet #urban #extraordinary #coronadays #solitude #abandonedworld

A post shared by Wandering Sarah (@sarahswanderings) on Apr 28, 2020 at 1:39am PDT

No, not even Harry Potter has been seen wandering around this iconic railway station lately. On a serious note, London has been heavily hit by the pandemic and that has directly impacted traffic flow in this historic place. Kudos to @sarahswanderings‚Äô photography though.

Bright Lights City Nights . üìç: Jembatan Reklamasi PIK üöÅ: DJI Mavic 2 Zoom . #dkijakarta #southjakarta #dkijakarta #infojakarta #aerial #westjakarta #indonesia #wonderfulindonesia #jktinfo #dji #djiindonesia #djimavic2zoom #djimavicpro #djimavic2pro #unitedbydrone #airvuz #asean #seasiaig #people #city #cinematography #dirumahaja #gadingdronepilots #drone #dronestagram #emptystreets @jakarta @seasiaig @jktinfo @jakarta_skylines @amazing_jakarta @jakartacityscape @jakarta.terkini @dkiinfo @jakarta @peduli.jakarta @airvuz @seasia.co @gnfi

Housing more than 40,000 people per square mile, Jakarta‚Äôs residents and tourists take to the streets as soon as dusk falls and the vibrant city beckons. That was before COVID-19 though, as @ariotrihantoro presents the city in its current form.

E M P T Y R O M E (Vatican) . . #emptycities #covid_19 #rome #vaticano #empty #shallow #pandemic #daysarenights #march2020

A post shared by Roberto Ferrari (@robeach78) on Mar 28, 2020 at 12:07pm PDT

Rome didn‚Äôt fall in a day, but it did eventually! The sun may not have set on modern Rome but it does look tired of this very long lockdown period. One of the most popular tourist destinations, @robeach78 highlights an otherwise packed Saint Peter‚Äôs Square.

post_title: Vibrant but empty lane in Osaka
post_content:
View this post on Instagram

Living in a Ghost Town @therollingstones „Ç¥„Éº„Çπ„Éà„Çø„Ç¶„É≥ - „É≠„Éº„É™„É≥„Ç∞„Çπ„Éà„Éº„É≥ ‚Ä¢ A few weeks ago I was commissioned to collaborate on a project with a few different artists around the world by taking stills in an empty Osaka for Rolling Stones‚Äô new video single release ‚ÄúLiving in a Ghost Town‚Äù. Although there are no official lockdown measures in place here in Japan, cities are *slowly* changing after our State of Emergency was finally enacted just over 2 weeks ago. The global impacts and repercussions of this virus are unthinkable but to be involved in a project like this under the current circumstances is so awesome. I‚Äôve chosen a few favourites in these posts from all the shots I took on this day; which, despite the sadness of it all, gave me a new perspective on my adopted hometown. All profits made from this song will be donated to the NHS and Save the Children. I‚Äôm super proud to be involved in this project and I‚Äôm really digging the song too! Produced by Fred Bonham Carter and Directed by Joseph Connor. Thank you guys and even bigger thank you to my pal @andyhphoto for the link up! VIDEO LINKED IN MY BIO ü§ò ‚Ä¢ Just Fred Productions Director @joevconnor Colourist @richardfearon VEX Lead Dan Sanders @blackkitestudios Commissioner @semerakhan ‚Ä¢ Êï∞ÈÄ±ÈñìÂâç„Å´„ÄÅRolling Stones„ÅÆÊñ∞„Åó„ÅÑ„Éü„É•„Éº„Ç∏„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Éì„Éá„Ç™„ÄåGhost Town„Äç„ÅÆ„Éó„É≠„Ç∏„Çß„ÇØ„Éà„Å´ÂçîÂäõ„Åó„Åü„ÅÑ„Åã„Å©„ÅÜ„Åã„ÇíÂ∞ã„Å≠„Çã„É°„Éº„É´„ÅåÈÄÅ‰ø°„Åï„Çå„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ „Åì„ÅÆ„Éó„É≠„Ç∏„Çß„ÇØ„Éà„Å´„ÅØ„ÄÅÁßÅ„Å®‰∏ñÁïå‰∏≠„ÅÆÊï∞‰∫∫„ÅÆ„Ç¢„Éº„ÉÜ„Ç£„Çπ„Éà„ÅåÈñ¢‰∏é„Åó„ÄÅ„Ç≥„É≠„Éä„Ç¶„Ç§„É´„Çπ„ÅÆ‰∏≠„Å´„ÅÇ„ÇãÁßÅ„Åü„Å°„ÅÆÁ©∫„ÅÆÈÉΩÂ∏Ç„ÇíÊçï„Çâ„Åà„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ „Åì„ÅÆ„Éó„É≠„Ç∏„Çß„ÇØ„Éà„Å´ÂèÇÂä†„Åß„Åç„Åü„Åì„Å®„Çí„Å®„Å¶„ÇÇË™á„Çä„Å´ÊÄù„Å£„Å¶„Åä„Çä„ÄÅÂæó„Çâ„Çå„Åü„Åô„Åπ„Å¶„ÅÆÂà©Áõä„ÅØËã±ÂõΩ„ÅÆNHS„Å®Save the Children„ÉÅ„É£„É™„ÉÜ„Ç£„Éº„Å´ÂØÑ‰ªò„Åï„Çå„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ „Åì„ÅÆÊõ≤„ÅØÁ¥†Êô¥„Çâ„Åó„ÅÑ„ÅÆ„ÅßË¶ã„Å¶„Åè„Å†„Åï„ÅÑ„ÄÇ „Åì„ÅÆ„Éó„É≠„Ç∏„Çß„ÇØ„Éà„Å´Èñ¢„Çè„Å£„ÅüÁöÜ„Åï„Çì„ÄÅ„ÅÇ„Çä„Åå„Å®„ÅÜ„Åî„Åñ„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åó„ÅüÔºÅ ‚Ä¢ #rollingstones#therollingstones#ghosttown#covid19#london#osaka#lockdown#londonlockdown#empty#emptycities#landscapephotography#singlerelease#covid#fisheye#photography#onset#rocknroll#saveournhs#„É≠„Éº„É™„É≥„Ç∞„Çπ„Éà„Éº„É≥#„Ç≥„É≠„Éä„Ç¶„Ç§„É´„Çπ#Â§ßÈò™#„Ç¥„Éº„Çπ„Éà„Çø„Ç¶„É≥

A post shared by Sam „Çµ„É† (@samanthamilligan) on Apr 24, 2020 at 12:52am PDT

Home of the first Universal Studios theme park outside the US, Osaka is a lively Japanese city that probably hasn‚Äôt witnessed such barren streets in a long time. Welcoming more than 10 million visitors a year, it has bustling energy, great restaurants, and pubs.

sub_category_description:
Plunged into disarray by the pandemic, these stunning cities bear little resemblance to their former selves; a foreign, mystifying, yet beautiful sight. 
 
As COVID-19 gathers pace and wreaks further havoc throughout the globe, countries are forced to extend stay-at-home orders to preserve the lives of their citizens. Cities and streets are, therefore, desolate and devoid of people, revealing an all-new side to their landscape that is moving and eerie at the same time. From the lit-up streets of Australia to picturesque sunsets at Miami, these overwhelming images of famous cities also serve as subtle reminders to just why we fell in love with them in the first place.

post_title: An unusual evening in Mexico City
post_content:
View this post on Instagram

La explanada del Palacio de Bellas Artes sin personas. Todos los accesos a esta zona han sido cerrados (2020).

A post shared by @ santiago_arau on Apr 22, 2020 at 1:26pm PDT

There are almost always at least 1000 people around the Palacio de Bellas Artes. Mexico City is the most populous city in North America and has a rich culture and history. @santiago_arau‚Äôs picture though, allows us to only admire the facade of the buildings.

View this post on Instagram

GhostCity | ü¶† | Quarantine - Toronto - On. The Queensway W., close to CNE, one of the busiest streets empty at 4pm, rush hour.

A post shared by carlosbezz (@carlosbezz) on Mar 26, 2020 at 12:46pm PDT

One car on Queensway street post-afternoon? Almost unheard of ‚Äî but true nonetheless! @carlosbezz‚Äôs image is a testament to the drastic change seen in Toronto, which in normal times witnesses 40 million tourists every year while housing seven major sports teams as well.
